question: Massive ground-dwelling bird of the Thar desert; males display a tall black crest and white wing panel. Identify it.
info: Tall bustard of arid grasslands and scrub in Rajasthan/Gujarat; long legs, heavy body, striking white wing patches in flight.

question: Slender riverine bird that skims the water with its lower mandible at dusk; often on large northern rivers.
info: Distinct long orange bill with knife-like lower mandible; roosts on sandbars of the Ganga, Chambal, and Mahanadi systems.

question: Large, bare-headed scavenger with a red head and powerful bill; now very local in the NE and gangetic plains.
info: Also called Asian King Vulture; dark body, bright red head. Now scarce; look near carcasses in forested/agrarian mosaics.

question: Tall wetland crane with a red head and upper neck; pairs perform loud bugling duets in NW and central India.
info: World’s tallest flying bird; prefers shallow wetlands and paddy fields; often seen in bonded pairs.

question: Secretive forest owl rediscovered in Satpuras in the 1990s after being ‘lost’ for decades.
info: Small, big-headed owl with bold barring; diurnal tendencies; dry deciduous forest of central India.

question: Gangetic mega-stork with a massive wedge-shaped bill and bare head; scavenges near dumps and wetlands in Assam/Bihar.
info: Huge stork with pendant throat pouch; stronghold around Guwahati landfills and nearby wetlands.

question: Shy duck of forested wetlands in NE India; large white wing patch visible in flight.
info: https://ebird.org/species/indbus1

question: Slender black-and-white tern of big rivers; dark belly and orange bill distinguish it.
info: Breeds on sandbars; declining on many Indian rivers; note dark underparts in breeding plumage.

question: NE hill forests babbler first described in 2006 from Arunachal; olive-green with orange throat wash.
info: Very localized around Eaglenest WLS; skulks in dense undergrowth along forest edges.

question: Large hornbill with rufous neck and bluish facial skin; breeds in tall evergreen forests of NE India.
info: Male with rufous neck and dark bill; prefers mature forests with large fruiting trees.

question: Tall stork with duller plumage than its larger cousin; widespread but declining in wetlands.
info: Smaller adjutant; bare head, heavy bill; breeds in trees near marshes.

question: Elusive nightjar-like bird from scrub and rocky plateaus of Andhra Pradesh; extremely difficult to find.
info: Nocturnal, long-legged courser; favors sparse scrub with open patches; one of India’s most secretive birds.

question: Large heron of wide rivers in NE India; pale gray with a striking white belly.
info: Among the world’s rarest herons; hunts along quiet river stretches with big rocks and overhanging trees.

question: River-island megapode from the Nicobars; builds huge mound nests of leaves and sand.
info: Male and female tend large incubation mounds; coastal scrub and forest edges on Nicobar Islands.

question: Graceful white-and-black vulture with contrasting dark mantle; was once abundant across India.
info: Compact vulture with short bill; often roosts in tall roadside trees near villages and fields.

question: Long-legged plover of sandy riverbanks; bold face mask and chestnut crown are key.
info: Breeds on open shingle and sandbars; wary and often in pairs away from disturbance.

question: Heavy-billed migrant duck occasionally wintering in NE India; males show dark head and white flanks.
info: Favors vegetated lakes and marshes; rarity worth documenting with photos if found.

question: Gangetic sandbar nester with thin black mask and orange bill; dives for fish near the surface.
info: Commoner than skimmer; gray upperparts, white below, orange bill with black tip in breeding.

question: Stocky tree-nester vulture of NE India with unusually slender bill for a vulture.
info: Pale-headed with slim, long bill; breeds in tall trees; mostly in Assam and adjoining areas.

question: Shy forest pigeon from the Andamans; slate-gray with iridescent neck feathers.
info: Endemic to Andamans’ evergreen forests; low, resonant calls; prefers tall primary forest.

question: Elegant crane of high Ladakh plateau; black neck and head with white crown patch.
info: Breeds around high-altitude marshes and meadows; sacred to local communities.

question: Large woodpecker of NE foothills with creamy head and stout bill; excavates big nest holes.
info: Uncommon in moist broadleaf forests; listen for loud drumming and harsh calls.

question: Slaty-grey duck of Andamans with white face crescent; skulks in mangrove-lined creeks.
info: Small dabbling duck; forages in saline/brackish wetlands and mangroves; often in small groups.

question: Shy rail from the Andamans; chestnut head/neck, olive-brown upperparts, and barred flanks.
info: Often heard more than seen in dense undergrowth near streams and forest edges.

question: Forest pheasant of the western Himalaya; male is richly patterned with red and black, with white-spotted flanks.
info: Elusive in steep temperate forests with dense understory; high conservation priority in HP/J&K.
